濴字的基本解释

濴
yíng
〔??（
d媙g ）濴〕细小的水流，如“梁弱水之濴濴兮。”

濴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yíng］
［《廣韻》余傾切，平青，以。］
水泉貌；小水貌。

濴字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　濴； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页657第29
【廣韻】余傾切，音營。【玉篇】水泉貌。一曰波勢回貌。【集韻】同濚。

濴字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
濴字的起名意思

暂无。

Zhu
Basic explanation of words
Zhu
yíng
〔?? (
d 媙g) 濴] small water flow, such as "the beam is weak and the water is shining."

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yíng］
["Guangyun" Yu Qingqie, Pingqing, Yi. ]
Water spring appearance; small water appearance.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Ji 1] [Shui Zi Department] 　濴; Kangxi strokes: 18; page number: page 657 29
[Guang Yun] Yu Qingqie, Yinying. [Jade articles] The appearance of the water spring. One said the wave of momentum returned to its appearance. [Ji Yun] Tong Zhu.
